com.coveros.selenified.element.check

Class VerifyState

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.coveros.selenified.element.check.VerifyState

  • public class VerifyState
extends Object
    VerifyState implements State to provide some additional verification capabilities. It will handle all verifications performed on the actual element. These asserts are custom to the framework, and in addition to providing easy object oriented capabilities, they take screenshots with each verification to provide additional traceability, and assist in troubleshooting and debugging failing tests. State checks that elements are in a particular state.
    Version:
    3.2.1
    Author:
    Max Saperstone

    • Method Detail

      • present

        public void present()
        Verifies that the element is present. This information will be logged and recorded, with a screenshot for traceability and added debugging support.

      • notPresent

        public void notPresent()
        Verifies that the element is not present. This information will be logged and recorded, with a screenshot for traceability and added debugging support.

        Verifies that the element is displayed. This information will be logged and recorded, with a screenshot for traceability and added debugging support.

        public void checked()
        Verifies that the element is checked. This information will be logged and recorded, with a screenshot for traceability and added debugging support.

      • notChecked

        public void notChecked()
        Verifies that the element is not checked. This information will be logged and recorded, with a screenshot for traceability and added debugging support.

      • editable

        public void editable()
        Verifies that the element is editable. If the element isn't an input, this will constitute a failure, same as it not being editable. This information will be logged and recorded, with a screenshot for traceability and added debugging support.

      • notEditable

        public void notEditable()
        Verifies that the element is not editable. If the element isn't an input, this will constitute a pass, as non input elements are not editable. This information will be logged and recorded, with a screenshot for traceability and added debugging support.

      • enabled

        public void enabled()
        Verifies that the element is enabled. This information will be logged and recorded, with a screenshot for traceability and added debugging support.

      • notEnabled

        public void notEnabled()
        Verifies that the element is not enabled. This information will be logged and recorded, with a screenshot for traceability and added debugging support.

      • changeDefaultWait

        public void changeDefaultWait(double seconds)
        Changes the default wait time from 5.0 seconds to some custom number.
        Parameters:
        seconds - - how many seconds should WaitFor wait for the condition to be met

      • changeDefaultPoll

        public void changeDefaultPoll(long milliseconds)
        Changes the default poll time from 500.0 milliseconds to some custom number.
        Parameters:
        milliseconds - - how many milliseconds should WaitFor wait between pollings for the condition to be met
